alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern York , the City of Poquoson, the City of Hampton and the City of Newport News through 630 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tabb, or near Seaford, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, Hampton University, Langley AFB, Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Northampton, Buckroe Beach, Grand View, Denbigh, Tabb, Fort Monroe, Beaconsdale, Oriana, Hilton Village, Oyster Point, Messick, Hornsbyville and Harris Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
